definition: to bewail one's poverty/to complain about being hard up/to pretend to be poor
to cry/to weep
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly

sentences.english: She usually poor-mouths when it's her turn to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 輪到她捐錢時，她老是哭窮。

sentences.english: She always pleaded poverty and pared down prices.
sentences.chinese: 她老是哭窮，買東西總要討價還價。

sentences.english: Don't poor-mouth to me. I have your number.
sentences.chinese: 別跟我哭窮了，我還不知道你的祕聞？

sentences.english: Don't poor-mouth to me, I have your number.
sentences.chinese: 別跟我哭窮了，我知道你的底細。

sentences.english: I have got a problem with the spate of wealthy people now crying poverty.
sentences.chinese: 對於現在很多富人哭窮我感到不解。

definition: compassion/empathetic
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
a falling leaf returns to the roots (idiom); everything has its ancestral home/In old age, an expatriate longs to return home.
Vertical Alliance, clique of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
fellow villager
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
root of Chinese pulsatilla/Chinese bulbul
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
unstable/erratic/changeable/fickle
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
extinct
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
